questions.question_text: Which node automatically assumes the active role when peers boot simultaneously and their health scores are equivalent in a High Availability (HA) scenario?

discussion.content: D is correct, If both SBCs in the HA node boot up at the same time, they negotiate with each other for the active role. If both systems have perfect health, then the SBC with the lowest HA rear interface IPv4 address becomes the active SBC. The SBC with the higher HA rear interface IPv4 address becomes the standby SBC.
C, es el ultimo activo ya que los dos bootean al mismo tiempo

choices.C: the node that had the role of active last
choices.B: the node that is configured as secondary
choices.E: the node with the highest round-robin score
choices.D: the node with the lowest wancom IP address
choices.A: the node with the highest wancom IP address

discussion.content: Correct answers IMO are A and C

questions.question_text:
You are troubleshooting a SIP routing issue and you have access to the SIP call flow processed by the Session Border Controller.
Which two steps are valid for troubleshooting this type of issues? (Choose two.)

choices.A: It is necessary to locate the SIP session to troubleshoot and check if there is a 404 Routes Not Found SIP error message.
choices.C: It is recommended to check the called number by looking at the Request-URI of the INVITE message and making sure it is a valid number to be routed.
choices.D: It is recommended to find the CANCEL method received by the Session Border Controller which typically identifies a SIP routing issue.
choices.E: It is necessary to find an initial INVITE received by the Session Border Controller which gets a 503 Service Unavailable SIP error message.
choices.B: It is recommended to look for 183 Session Progress SIP error messages that indicate routing issues.

discussion.content:
The key here is that it refers to Volatile RAM. Then it is the done command.

if it was referring to non-Volatile RAM, then it would be the save-config...

choices.D: From user mode, execute the commit-config command.
choices.E: From superuser mode, execute the save-config command.
choices.C: From user mode, execute the save-config command.
choices.B: From superuser mode, execute the write-config command.
choices.A: From configuration mode, execute the done command.

questions.question_text:
You made a configuration change to a media interface.
Which command must be executed to commit the change to volatile (RAM) memory?

You are associating network-interface configuration elements with a physical-interface configuration element on the Session Border Controller.
Which parameter must contain the same unique ID in these two configuration elements?

The Session Border Controller needs to be configured to act as a Back-to-Back User Agent (B2BUA).
How would you accomplish this?

choices.B: Navigate to the sip-config configuration element and set the operation-mode to dialog.
choices.D: Navigate to the session-router configuration element and set the operation-mode to dialog.
choices.E: Navigate to the session-router configuration element and set the operation-mode to none.
choices.A: Navigate to the sip-config configuration element and set the operation-mode to stateless.
choices.C: Navigate to the sip-config configuration element and set the operation-mode to stateful.

comments.content:
Yep. 

(sip-config)# operation-mode

<enumeration> SIP operation mode
disabled SIP operation disabled
stateless Stateless Proxy forwarding
transaction Transaction Stateful Proxy
session Session/Call Stateful Proxy
dialog Dialog Stateful (B2BUA)

discussion.content:
Correct answer is B.
Operation-mode is under Sip-Config element
